channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Author Geraldine Brooks learned some hard personal-finance lessons when her husband died unexpectedly
item.description: “Memorial Days” is a memoir of grief, but also a practical reminder of the impact of money on anyone’s life.

item.title: RoboBusiness announces 2025 agenda
item.description: RoboBusiness will explore physical AI, humanoids, and other emerging technologies and applications driving the robotics industry. The post RoboBusines...

item.title: It’s Qwen’s summer: new open source Qwen3-235B-A22B-Thinking-2507 tops OpenAI, Gemini reasoning models on key benchmarks
item.description: The new Qwen3-Thinking-2507, as we'll call it for short, now leads or closely trails top-performing models across several major benchmarks.

item.title: EngineAI raises nearly $140M to develop legged, humanoid robots
item.description: EngineAI has raised pre-A++ and A1 funding to further develop its humanoid robots and bring them to a competitive market. The post EngineAI raises nea...

item.title: Foxglove includes audio support in latest platform update
item.description: Foxglove said users can use its new Audio panel to zoom in and pan across the audio waveform, and click to jump to areas of interest. The post Foxglov...

item.title: The Download: saving the US climate programs, and America’s AI protections are under threat
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. How nonprofi...

item.title: AutoNation’s stock rises as higher car prices help it beat sales and profit estimates
item.description: Customers shrugged off higher prices and drove up sales, while AutoNation said it’s well positioned to handle higher tariffs.

item.title: Social Security Administration quietly corrects blog on taxation of benefits — but confusion persists
item.description: Public comments on the agency’s blog show beneficiaries remain confused about the new law.

item.title: Charter is bleeding internet subscribers — and the stock could see its worst day ever
item.description: A downbeat earnings report, plus investor disdain for the pending Cox Communications merger, is sending the stock to a one-year low.

item.title: Swan EndoSurgical debuts to advance GI Robotics
item.description: The new company will focus on developing a novel robotic system for gastrointestinal patient care. The companies will jointly invest up to $458 millio...

item.title: PayPal’s ‘battleground’ stock heads for longest winning streak in years. Earnings are on deck.
item.description: PayPal’s stock is on track to rise for the eighth session in a row, but analysts have a hard time making a call about the future.

item.title: How nonprofits and academia are stepping up to salvage US climate programs
item.description: Nonprofits are striving to preserve a US effort to modernize greenhouse-gas measurements, amid growing fears that the Trump administration’s dismantli...

item.title: The deadly saga of the controversial gene therapy Elevidys
item.description: It has been a grim few months for the Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) community. There had been some excitement when, a couple of years ago, a gene ...

item.title: Anthropic unveils ‘auditing agents’ to test for AI misalignment
item.description: Anthropic developed its auditing agents while testing Claude Opus 4 for alignment issues.

item.title: White House plan signals “open-weight first” era—and enterprises need new guardrails
item.description: Enterprises will not see immediate impact from the AI Action Plan, but it signals wider support for open-source models and evaluations.

item.title: Freed says 20,000 clinicians are using its medical AI transcription ‘scribe,’ but competition is rising fast
item.description: Rather than chase enterprise contracts with large hospital systems, Freed has focused on small clinics and solo practitioners.

item.title: Richtech Robotics’ ADAM serves drinks at Kennedy Space Center
item.description: Richtech Robotics says its ADAM robot has served more than 16,000 drinks as its robots enter new venues beyond hospitality. The post Richtech Robotics...

item.title: America’s AI watchdog is losing its bite
item.description: Most Americans encounter the Federal Trade Commission only if they’ve been scammed: It handles identity theft, fraud, and stolen data. During the Bide...

item.title: Trump’s AI Action Plan is a distraction
item.description: On Wednesday, President Trump issued three executive orders, delivered a speech, and released an action plan, all on the topic of continuing American ...

item.title: SecurityPal combines AI and experts in Nepal to speed enterprise security questionnaires by 87X or more
item.description: The Kathmandu center of excellence gives SecurityPal a cost base low enough to keep humans in the loop while staying price-competitive.

item.title: Advance Trustworthy AI and ML, and Identify Best Practices for Scaling AI
item.description: By John P. Desmond, AI Trends Editor Advancing trustworthy AI and machine learning to mitigate agency risk is a priority for the US Department of Ener...

item.title: Best Practices for Building the AI Development Platform in Government

item.description: By AI Trends Staff While AI in hiring is now widely used for writing job descriptions, screening candidates, and automating interviews, it poses a ris...

item.title: Predictive Maintenance Proving Out as Successful AI Use Case
item.description: By John P. Desmond, AI Trends Editor More companies are successfully exploiting predictive maintenance systems that combine AI and IoT sensors to coll...

item.title: Novelty In The Game Of Go Provides Bright Insights For AI And Autonomous Vehicles
